title: The school that puts the kids in charge
intro: What happens when you put the kids in charge of the school? Phil and Georgie discuss this and teach you some useful vocabulary.
this_week_question: What do children at the Bamboo School have to do instead of paying school fees?
a) teach lessons b) learn english, or c) plant trees
Listen to the programme to hear the answer.

vocab.desc: have the power to make the important decisions which can influence a situation
being actively involved in doing something practical, rather than talking about it or getting someone else to do it
used to describe how the world really is, in contrast to a particular person’s view which may be unrealistic or untypical; reality rather than an idea, wish or dream
work that is done without pay to help people in a community

transcript.text: Twice a week, children go to the vegetable market with a school officer and buy food for all 150 students.
